hero.subtitle: I live entrepreneurship as an evidence, as a need to create and develop. My obsession: constantly pushing my limits and discovering how far I can go.

intro.title: Build, develop, exceed my skills
intro.paragraph_1: Guided by a single obsession: build, develop, exceed my skills, learn always and forever.
intro.paragraph_2: Several companies, with successes and failures, have forged me. In 2017, I launch a national company that takes off, develops so fast that it was difficult to follow its ascent‚Ä¶
intro.paragraph_3: Then Covid and what followed. Devastated, I had to rebuild myself from within. In July 2024, I left to expatriate to Thailand.
intro.quote: Adrenaline nourishes me. Routine extinguishes me. I want challenges, unexpected events, that pressure that pushes to invent and exceed oneself. That's where I feel fully alive.

timeline.title: My entrepreneurial journey
timeline.subtitle: Each step has shaped my vision and mission today
timeline.before_2017: Before 2017: Several companies created with successes as well as failures. Successes that gave me confidence, failures that taught me humility and taught me. Each experience forged my resilience and refined my entrepreneurial vision.

event_1.title: The lightning takeoff
event_1.description: Launch of a brand that experiences explosive growth. A dizzying ascent that defies all predictions.
event_1.lesson: Success can come faster than we imagine

event_2.title: The fall and annihilation
event_2.description: Covid strikes. In less than two years, everything collapses. A brutal shock, a total loss... but also a revelation.
event_2.lesson: Sometimes you have to lose everything to find everything

event_3.title: The decision to take the big leap
event_3.description: At 48, I make the decision that will change my life: expatriate. Leave my comfort zone to be reborn elsewhere.
event_3.lesson: It's never too late to start over

event_4.title: Destination Thailand
event_4.description: July 2024: I settle permanently in Thailand. No network, no help. Alone. Every step becomes a challenge.
event_4.lesson: Expatriation reveals our true inner strength

event_5.title: A year cut off from the world
event_5.description: From 4 AM to 11 PM 7/7. Barely seeing my children... The most heartbreaking sacrifice for one goal: create the first platform that will unite all expats worldwide.
event_5.lesson: The greatest projects are born in solitude and relentlessness

event_6.title: The birth of the ecosystem
event_6.description: August 2025: simultaneous launch of SOS-Expat and Ulixai based in Estonia. Two platforms, 4 missions: connect expats worldwide.
event_6.lesson: The best ideas are born from our own struggles

visa_guide.title: Complete Guide to European Visas: Everything You Need to Know
visa_guide.excerpt: Navigate the complex world of European visas with this comprehensive guide covering requirements, processes, and expert tips for success.
visa_guide.intro: Moving to a new country can be one of life's most exciting adventures, but navigating the visa process doesn't have to be overwhelming. This comprehensive guide will walk you through everything you need to know about obtaining visas for European countries.
visa_guide.section_1_intro: European countries offer different types of visas depending on your purpose of visit. The most common categories include:
visa_guide.tourist_visa_desc: For short-term visits up to 90 days
visa_guide.work_visa_desc: For employment purposes with specific employer sponsorship
visa_guide.student_visa_desc: For educational pursuits at recognized institutions
visa_guide.schengen_desc: One of the most important concepts to understand is the Schengen Area, which allows free movement between 27 European countries with a single visa. This means once you have a Schengen visa, you can travel freely within all member countries during your authorized stay period.
visa_guide.documents_intro: Regardless of visa type, you'll typically need:
visa_guide.doc_passport: Valid passport with at least 6 months remaining validity
visa_guide.pro_tip_content: Always check specific requirements for your destination country, as regulations can change frequently. Consider consulting directly with the embassy or consulate for the most up-to-date information.
visa_guide.timeline_intro: Visa processing times can vary significantly based on your nationality, visa type, and time of year. Generally, you should:
visa_guide.timeline_1: Apply 3-4 weeks before your intended travel date
visa_guide.timeline_2: Schedule appointments well in advance, especially during peak seasons
visa_guide.timeline_3: Prepare all documents thoroughly to avoid delays
visa_guide.timeline_4: Consider premium processing services if available and necessary
visa_guide.conclusion: The visa process may seem daunting at first, but with proper preparation and understanding of requirements, you'll be well on your way to your European adventure. Remember, every successful expat started exactly where you are now - with a dream and the determination to make it happen.

banking_nomad.title: Digital Banking for Nomads: Best International Banking Solutions
banking_nomad.excerpt: Discover the top banking solutions for digital nomads and expats, including multi-currency accounts and international transfer options.
banking_nomad.intro: As a digital nomad or expat, managing your finances across multiple countries can be challenging. This guide explores the best banking solutions for mobile professionals.
banking_nomad.challenges_desc: Digital nomads face unique challenges: high exchange fees, blocked accounts, difficulties opening accounts without fixed address, and managing multiple currencies.
banking_nomad.digital_banks_desc: Revolut, Wise (formerly TransferWise), and N26 offer solutions specifically designed for digital nomads.
banking_nomad.traditional_banks_desc: HSBC, BNP Paribas International, and Cr√©dit Agricole International offer dedicated expat services.
banking_nomad.tip_1: Always keep at least two accounts with different banks
banking_nomad.tip_2: Inform your banks of your travels to avoid blocks
banking_nomad.tip_3: Use financial management apps to track your expenses
banking_nomad.tip_4: Negotiate banking fees as an international client
banking_nomad.conclusion: With the right banking solutions, managing your finances as a digital nomad becomes much simpler. The initial investment in researching and setting up these tools will save you time and money in the long run.

housing_berlin.title: Finding Housing in Berlin: An Expat's Complete Guide
housing_berlin.excerpt: Master the Berlin housing market with insider tips on neighborhoods, rental processes, and avoiding common pitfalls.
housing_berlin.intro: Berlin's housing market can be intimidating for newcomers, but with the right approach and knowledge, you can find your ideal home.
housing_berlin.market_desc: Berlin remains relatively affordable compared to other European capitals, but demand is strong. Patience and preparation are essential.
housing_berlin.conclusion: Finding housing in Berlin requires perseverance, but the city offers exceptional quality of life. With this guide, you're better prepared to navigate the Berlin real estate market.

healthcare_expat.title: Healthcare Systems for Expats: What You Need to Know
healthcare_expat.excerpt: Understanding healthcare systems abroad, insurance requirements, and how to access quality medical care as an expat.
healthcare_expat.intro: Healthcare is one of the most important considerations when moving abroad. This guide helps you navigate international healthcare systems.
healthcare_expat.conclusion: Good health preparation will allow you to live your expatriation peacefully. Don't hesitate to get support from professionals specialized in expat health.

culture_shock.title: Overcoming Culture Shock: A Practical Guide
culture_shock.excerpt: Learn how to navigate cultural differences and adapt successfully to your new environment with proven strategies.
culture_shock.intro: Culture shock is a natural part of the expat experience, but it doesn't have to derail your international journey. Here's how to overcome it.
culture_shock.conclusion: Culture shock is temporary and surmountable. With patience, open-mindedness and the right strategies, you'll transform this trial into an extraordinary personal growth opportunity.

moving_checklist.title: The Ultimate International Moving Checklist
moving_checklist.excerpt: A comprehensive checklist covering everything from documentation to logistics for a smooth international move.
moving_checklist.intro: International moving requires careful planning and organization. This comprehensive checklist guides you step by step.
moving_checklist.conclusion: A well-planned international move is the key to successful expatriation. This checklist will help you not forget anything and approach your new life with serenity.

bio.short_content: Williams Jullin is a global mobility expert and entrepreneur who has transformed international relocation through innovative platforms SOS-Expat and Ulixai, serving over 500,000 expats worldwide.
bio.long_paragraph_1: Williams Jullin is a pioneering figure in global mobility, having transformed the international relocation landscape through innovative technology and comprehensive support networks.
bio.long_paragraph_2: As the founder of SOS-Expat and Ulixai, Williams has created an ecosystem that addresses every aspect of the expat journey, from emergency assistance to comprehensive relocation planning.
bio.long_paragraph_3: His platforms have successfully supported over 500,000 expats across 25+ countries, establishing him as a leading authority in international mobility and expat services.
